intro: Yuezhuea, commonly known as the Chinese sandmat, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, green, ovate leaves and produces tiny, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Yuezhuea is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. It is often found in rocky soils and is used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
